Our wars in the future will no longer be fought with the dadao and the rifle but rather by the devastating breakthrough potential of armoured units.

name: Establish the Central Military Academy
description: With the completion of Dr. Sun's vision, there no longer exists a need to host the Whampoa Military Academy in Guangzhou. Let us move this distinguished military school to our national capital to create a centralised military academy. This will help our central command structure and encourage recruits from all across the country to learn from the best officers China has to offer.

name: Integrate the Warlords
description: Despite the unification of the country, there exists still plenty of warlord generals and armies who have yet to lay down their arms to the central government. Let us offer amnesty to these generals so that their troops may now service the new Republic of China - and ensure that the armies of this country remain under the control of the Party.

name: Chinese Industrial Cooperatives
description: As a result of the chaos of the wars of unification and resistance, thousands of Chinese men and women find themselves either refugees or out of work. In order to make up for China's lost industrial capacity, we will organise industrial cooperatives for workers to receive voting shares and to contribute to China's growing arms industries. Not only will this encourage the masses' support of the Party but it will also help us direct much needed efforts towards reviving our arms industries.

name: The Army of the Republic
description: Despite the NRA's problems after the unification, we have succeeded in our reforms to modernise and equip the NRA for future conflicts. Every day, we receive new and eager recruits ready to be taught by battle-hardened veterans of the NRA. As the true army of the Chinese Republic, our armed forces shall be a testament to the success of Chinese modernisation for generations to come. Long live the National Revolutionary Army, long live the Chinese Kuomintang!

name: The Central Aviation Academy
description: Prior to the unification, air efforts throughout the country were mostly localised to local provincial attempts to create small air forces. As part of our overall army modernisation efforts and in the spirit of the Chinese National Revolution, let us create the Central Aviation Academy to train our pilots for future conflicts and also train them to uphold the ideals of the sanminzhuyi.

name: Expand the Military Air Industry
description: While before the unification and the completion of the Northern Expedition our party lacked an airforce, we have began efforts since the unification to increase our aircraft production. Let us provide government subsidies to help speed up the construction of new factories to help us churn out the production of China's very own air force.

name: Develop Our Own Fighters
description: With the creation of our own native air industries, let us pursue the production of our own domestic fighters such as the Chu (AFAMF) XP-0. This monoplane will be able to serve dual purposes as both a fighter and a dive bomber in the skies.

name: Terror from the Skies
description: As the conflicts around the world showed us, modern wars are also won by intense bombing campaigns to target enemy industrial complexes and military apparatuses. Let us encourage our pilots and air designers to study European bomber designs so that we can adopt a similar air doctrine focused on firepower from above.

name: Close-Air Support Integration
description: We have learned from observing the modern European conduct of war from countries such as the German Empire and the Union of Britain, that close-air support is essential to the mobility of the modern battlefield. Let us seek to emulate their progress by studying and purchasing foreign bombers for the purposes of advancing our own air force.

name: Naval Targeting Aerial Programme
description: As the War of Resistance taught us, one of China's greatest weaknesses are that it can fall victim to an outright superior naval power such as the Empire of Japan or the German Empire. In order to combat foreign navies, let us encourage the training and study of naval targeting programmes with our naval bombers so that we may be able to fight naval battles even when our fleets are outnumbered.

name: Revive the Republic of China Navy
description: With the completion of the national unification and the fulfilment of Dr. Sun's vision, we must now take steps to transform our once fledgling provincial naval forces into the new national navy. Let us revive the Republic of China Navy under the flag of the White Sun and encourage the construction of dockyards across the coast of China to meet our growing need for ships.

name: Last Voyage of the Beiyang Admirals
description: As a result of the unification wars, some of China's best admirals and naval officers now find themselves out of work since the National Unification. We shall offer them full government amnesty so that these naval officers can train and lead the next generation of Chinese sailors on the high seas as part of China's new revolutionary navy.

name: Destroyer Programme
description: "Any modern Navy requires Destroyer vessels to make up its lighter support. Thus, a programme to fund and build these ships is highly supported by the new Republican Navy, and will be highly beneficial to our overall naval building efforts.

name: Death from the Depths
description: The next step in building our Navy are submarines. Many modern navies use these ships to attack convoys and fleets across the many oceans, which would be wonderful for disrupting our many enemies in the Pacific, as well as protect our shores from would-be invaders. This would be a wonderful step to a full modern Navy.

name: Chinese Cruiser Modernisation Scheme
description: As part of our naval reform efforts, we should also seek to modernise our larger ships such as light cruisers. With China's massive industrial potential, there is no doubt that with time - we will be able to develop our own ambitious cruiser modernisation efforts and create a Republican Navy that can rival that of our greatest rivals.

name: Prepare for the Storm
description: The next wars will involve the whole country and our coastline carries some of China's greatest industry. If we are to protect our country from being invaded or attacked at sea, then let us take efforts to modernise and develop coastal fortifications equipped with modern radar stations to project our power across the South and East China Seas.

name: The Final Struggle
description: Taiwan has been a Japanese colony for far too long. Having long been a part of China until it was regrettably stolen from us in 1895, and any attempts at resistance against the Japanese invader were crushed. But we will not make the same mistakes the Manchu made back then. With our forces built up, it is time to show the world that China is a force to be reckoned with again!

name: White Sun over China
description: Though the process has been arduous, we have finally consolidated our rule across the nation and can begin the official formation of a new republic under the White Sun. We must now lay the groundwork for the next stage in our revolution, integrating all provinces in China to the organs of our government.

name: Nationalist Land Reform
description: Peasants form the absolute majority of the Chinese population yet few of them own the land they work, killing any chance of socio-economic advancement. Land reform is a necessity to improve their livelihoods and reduce social tensions. Until the peasants of China own the land instead of leasing it from corrupt landlords, they will never be free.

name: Land Value Tax
description: Sun Yat-sen pushed for a Land Value Tax to be adopted in order to improve the country's finances, help push for land reform, and create a fairer taxation and economic system. We must implement his vision to help modernise the country and improve the economy.

name: Expand the Civil Service
description: To endure in the long run, the Nationalist Government must be more than a warlord clique or a party-state. A civil service that is independent of both the Kuomintang party apparatus and the army must begin formation.

name: Organic Law of the Republic
description: While Political Tutelage continues and the final Constitution is drafted, the Organic Law of the National Government has been promulgated. This act reorganised the National Government into five branches, or Yuan, and reinforced the Kuomintang's exercise of sovereign power for the duration of Political Tutelage.

name: Sanmin Doctrine
description: The Three Principles of the People, or Sanmin Doctrine, is the basis of Sun Yat-sen's political philosophy and the Kuomintang. The Principles guide our government in its policies and decisions, and their importance must be understood by the people in the coming fight.

name: Minzu
description: Minzu, or Nationalism, is one of Sun Yat-sen's Three Principles of the People and revolves around a common livelihood, language, religion, customs, and most importantly, a shared bloodline. National unity is paramount to our success, and shall allow China to succeed against other nations in the struggle for supremacy.

name: Minquan
description: Minquan, or Democracy, is the second of Sun Yat-sen's Three Principles of the People. Creating democratic institutions and preparing the Chinese people for them is one of the most important objectives of the National Revolution and will, in the long-run, prove that the Party is the best choice for China.

name: Legislative Yuan
description: While China is not anywhere ready for full elections, the Nationalist Government needs to begin forming the institutions that democracy will, one day, make its will known through. The Legislative Yuan, staffed by KMT representatives from both controlled and contested territories, will take over legislative responsibilities from the Central Committee.

name: Minsheng
description: Minsheng, commonly translated as 'The People's Welfare', is the last of Sun Yat-sen's Three Principles of the People. Following the implementation of a land value tax, social programmes will be created and expanded in order to help peasants and workers improve their quality of life by subsidising food consumption, clothing and housing costs.

name: Revive China Programme
description: Without the Nationalist Party, there will be no new China. A vast program of extensive state planning and initiatives is necessary to bring China back up to the same level as the West and alleviate the damaged economy.

name: Build the National Mausoleum
description: It is long past due to honour those who have fallen in service of Chinese Democracy. A national mausoleum will be constructed outside of [Root.Capital.GetCapitalVictoryPointName] to house the remains of Sun Yat-Sen and other prominent revolutionaries.

name: Academica Sinica
description: To better foster the development of our native scientific capabilities, the KMT must commit to creating and sponsoring our own academic research institutions. Long proposed but never enacted, the fully established Academica Sinica will be the centre of these efforts.

name: National Reconstruction Commission
description: Inspired by proposals drafted by Zhang Renjie, a centrally-directed National Reconstruction Commission should be formed by the Nationalist Government to plan a nationwide program of capital investments and standardisations. This program will involve multiple independently-scaling efforts centred around several major population centres.

name: Bo, Po, Mo, Fo...
description: The current methods for romanising Mandarin Chinese and even teaching the Chinese script are woefully inadequate for children or the everyday person. A new standard for phonetic symbols, similar to the Hiragana syllabary created for Japanese, should be created and spread throughout our educational system to help standardise the Chinese dialects and open mass conversation with the West.

name: Triumphant Revolution
description: China has finally been reunited under the White Sun, Blue Sky, and Wholly Red Earth of the Kuomintang. While there is still a long way to go before we recover from the Century of Humiliation, we have fulfilled the dream of the late Dr. Sun.

name: Expand the Whampoa Military Academy
description: The Kuomintang Military Academy was first founded by Sun Yat-sen in 1924 in Whampoa near Guangzhou and created a cadre of politically-conscious officers from those who trained there. While simply restoring it was sufficient previously, the transformation of the NRA into a truly national army requires Whampoa to be expanded in order to fill the need for politically reliable and capable officers.

name: Establish the Central Military Academy
description: With the revolution's hold over China secure, there is no longer any need for the Whampoa Military Academy to remain in Guangzhou. The distinguished military school will be moved to our national capital to create a centralised military academy. This will help our central command structure and encourage recruits from all across the country to learn from the best officers China has to offer.

name: Standardise Arsenals
description: For several decades, the arsenals of China have been under the control of different and largely independent provincial and national governments. Now that a number of those arsenals are under our control, the logistical issues stemming from different arsenals producing different arms in different calibre for a single army are substantial and should be rectified as soon as possible.

name: New Model Army
description: A professional volunteer army will be the future of the Chinese army: a smaller army devoted to the Three Principles of the People and the National Revolution, focusing on quality over quantity. This will create a greater Esprit de Corps and discipline, creating better soldiers that can perform difficult tasks and follow difficult orders.

name: The People's Army
description: The Chinese Army should take advantage of its manpower and size to fight wars. It should be a People's Army: One that represents the people and protects it. A pillar of national unification, not one of oppression or repression.

name: Unity Through Service
description: Widespread military service brings people from many regions together, giving them shared experiences and helping them see one another as brethren; concrete and true examples of brotherhood instead of vague concepts of nationhood. National unity will be strengthened by it.

name: Armoured Warfare
description: The development of armoured warfare has certainly been noticed in China, but to develop and use them here was but a pipe dream. Now that we are united and stronger than ever, now is the time to delve into these advanced technologies as an important stepping stone in China's modernisation.

name: Small Arms Development
description: Despite attempts by the numerous national and provincial governments to upgrade, the most widespread rifle in service remains the venerable, yet severely obsolete, Model 88. Making the standardisation on a new, modern rifle a reality rather than a project on paper is a top priority in order to improve our lacklustre military capabilities compared to other modern militaries.

name: Artillery Modernisation
description: Artillery is the king of the battlefield and modern pieces were a luxury in the warlord era. With the capabilities of a united China, we can modernise our guns and bring our firepower closer to the global standard.

name: Instil Army Discipline
description: The new Chinese army will be a professional one, focusing on military training full-time, encouraging high levels of discipline and skill. The example of the Iron Army will become a model for modern professional armies comparable to any Western power.

name: The NRA Revitalised
description: Despite the NRA's problems after the unification, we have succeeded in our reforms to modernise and equip the NRA for future conflicts. Every day, we receive new and eager recruits ready to be taught by battle-hardened veterans of the NRA. As the true army of the Chinese Republic, our armed forces shall be a testament to the success of Chinese modernisation for generations to come. Long live the National Revolutionary Army, long live the Chinese Kuomintang!

name: Formalise Aviation Schools
description: While there are indeed schools for pilots in China, they are few and relatively disorganised. Formalising these schools and creating a proper curriculum for pilots and maintenance crews will help create a proper air force for China.

name: New Aircraft Factories
description: The South of the country has seen a number of small aircraft workshops created in the last decade or two, but remained fairly small, only able to repair what few planes there were. Creating proper factories is another step towards developing a fledging aeronautics industry, a staple of the modern era.

name: Domestic Fighter Design
description: There have been a number of attempts at creating a Chinese aircraft, mostly based on foreign designs. With the help of foreign experts and an increasing pool of local technicians, we are now more than ever able to develop our own designs in the hopes of creating a modern air force to defend our skies.

name: Naval Bomber Project
description: While ignored at first, naval bombers armed with torpedoes and armour-piercing bombs are quickly becoming a serious threat to even the largest warships currently at sea. This technology might be exactly what China needs: A cost-effective way of destroying a vastly-larger enemy fleet threatening our coastline.

name: Tactical Bomber Fleet
description: Medium tactical bombers offer versatility to an air force with the ability to accomplish different types of mission. Of course, designing such a large plane has been unheard of until now and will certainly be a challenge.

name: Army Air Support
description: Light bombers as some kind of flying artillery is the best way an air force can support land operations. It is only logical that we focus on these close-air-support crafts as we forge a modern air force.

name: Expand Republican Dockyards
description: With the completion of the national unification and the fulfilment of Dr. Sun's vision, we must now take steps to transform our once fledgling provincial naval forces into the new national navy. Let us revive the Republic of China Navy under the flag of the White Sun and encourage the construction of dockyards across the coast of China to meet our growing need for ships.

name: Incorporate the Beiyang Fleet
description: As a result of the unification wars, some of China's best admirals and naval officers now find themselves out of work since the National Unification. We shall offer them full government amnesty so that these naval officers can train and lead the next generation of Chinese sailors on the high seas as part of China's new revolutionary navy.

name: Modern Destroyer Flotilla
description: Destroyers are the backbone of any modern navy, especially one as fledging as China's. They will protect our coasts, shipping lanes and larger warships from submarines and small attack crafts.

name: Develop Submarines
description: Submarines are proving to be indispensable in modern naval warfare. For a navy as limited as ours, they may prove to be a life saver, allowing us to attack far stronger enemies by raiding their shipping lanes and harassing their larger fleets.

name: Cruisers for our Fleet
description: Cruisers are important for scouting and screening and, realistically speaking, may be the largest warships we are capable of building at this time.

name: Focus on Coastal Defence
description: It would be insane to start planning for a large fleet capable of rivalling the naval Great Powers. As such, we must focus on a more flexible navy capable to protecting our long coast and interests in the Pacific.

name: A Grand Fleet
description: If China is to be considered a Great Power as it rightfully should be, a navy is indispensable. While it will certainly be a very long-term plan, our great navy must start somewhere and it must start now.

name: Nasīr's Reforms
description: The policies of Masqud Shah, that of exorbitantly high taxes and corvée labour, are so reviled by the people of Kumul that any progress towards ending them will be massively popular.

name: The 21 Begs
description: The 21 Begs, an assembly of the wealthiest Uyghur landowners in Kumul, have been pressuring Nasīr to take greater charge of the treasury in Kumul. The Begs wish for an updated census to reduce their tax burden.

name: Re-Ordering Taxes
description: The first demand of the Begs, the census and tax reform, can be done. Once a census of all tenants, free men and livestock is done, several forms of income, such as halal meat production and machine working can be exempt from taxation.

name: Minor Administration Reforms
description: The palace in Kumul is staffed by totally unqualified bureaucrats. Masqud Shah did not employ anybody with an Imperial Examination score. By simply asking our administrators to seek certification, we can weed out the worst hangers-on.

name: Adjusting the Advisory
description: The power of the two Advisors has always been a risk to the Khanate. Especially with Hoja-Niyaz. If we were to deploy the advisors to the city walls, we could possibly slip reforms past them.

name: The Kind Hand
description: Reforming the image of the Khan of Kumul requires constant support from the Begs. Through a more dignified appearance, adherence to Muslim customs, and the Begs' word of mouth, Nasīr Shah can be redeemed.

name: Opening Autonomy
description: Masqud Shah thought he could tighten his grip on power by closing the city to immigrants without Qing's authorisation. The Begs ask that additional Uyghur citizens be admitted into the city, and they be treated as free men.

name: The 30 Begs
description: With the additional Uyghur people coming to Kumul, it is beneficial if we add nine more men to the graft. Thirty Begs may be unable to break a tie, but we can benefit from their advice.

name: The Keys to Kumul
description: The power of the garrison in Kumul has rested with the Advisors for decades now. The Begs promise that their Uyghur levies can man the city walls without extorting the people so heavily. This would alleviate our worries.

name: Crush the Corvée
description: The use of corvée labour to keep land plots orderly and maintain the city was Masqud's idea. Under traditional islamic jurisprudence and Chinese civil law, corvée labour should not be used when the crimes of the labourers do not justify it.

name: The 2 Advisors
description: The two Advisor-Generals, Yulbars Khan and Hoja-Niyaz, have been pressuring Nasīr to protect his demesne. To begin, radical leftists must be listed and checked upon within Kumul. Just to be sure.

name: Adjusting Powers
description: Masqud Shah left behind a provisional role for his military advisors, doling out their roles based on his whim. A more concrete role of the Advisors will allow Yulbars Khan and Hoja-Niyaz to protect Kumul.

name: Niyaz's Ideals
description: Hoja-Niyaz, during his failed revolt against Nasīr's father, recalls his fighters fought better when they were supervised by an Imam and set aside time to pray each day. This policy, Hoja-Niyaz believes, will make the defenders of Kumul fight with the spirit of the warriors of old.

name: Yulbars' Doctrine
description: Yulbars Khan, having served the Khanate since the days of Nasīr's grandfather, has enough experience to be tapped into for reform suggestions. Yulbars Khan believes that converting soldier pay from silver to goods will engender more dependant soldiers.

name: Kumul Cavalry Regiment
description: The Advisors recommend the formation of a provisional Cavalry Regiment, based on the Hui Regiments. The advisors claim this will allow Nasīr to quickly end revolts that appear in Kumul from time to time.

name: Lowering Taxation
description: Another area of Yulbars Khan's reforms include lowering taxes on soldiers in our army, to encourage more to join, though it will mean slightly less tax revenue.

name: Maintaining the Khan's Powers
description: The Advisors project an image of Nasīr as a benevolent dictator who will protect Kumul from the waves of uncertainty Chinese bring. At the same time, they depict Nasīr as a victorious Chagatai like those that beat Tibet.

name: Side-lining the Begs
description: The 21 Begs of Kumul are a relic of Masqud Shah's loneliness and feeling of alienation from fellow Muslims due to his drunkenness. It is best if the Advisors met with Nasīr without consulting the Begs first.

name: Increased Constitutionalism
description: The wide variety of political constitutions that float around southern and eastern China have made it to Kumul. At the very least, they can serve as a basis for writing our future laws in a modern way.

name: Maintaining the Corvée
description: Though it is cruel, the Advisors have justified the punishment of forced labour outside Islamic jurisprudence by claiming the criminals are on the verge of becoming fajir, stating that this work will tire out their energy to commit crimes.

name: The Soft Fist
description: The Advisors have begun to expand their military policies into the other classes in Kumul. Those citizens who encounter them recognise Nasīr as a pious and safe departure from Masqud, to the people's splendour.

name: Xinjiang Administration
description: The day of subjugation is at hand thanks to the criminal Jin Shuren. Magistrates of the Khan must now contend with a Chinese garrison giving orders. It will take time for us to learn what the garrison wants out of our province.

name: New Taxes
description: The garrison's first request is to see the promised tribute to the Qing government. The tribute is obviously not there, and so the garrison has forced us to increase taxes on city people. This will infuriate the Uyghurs without a doubt.

name: Hire More Tax Collectors
description: The garrison has chastised our tax collectors, who are still holding out for the hope that Nasīr will be released. We must now take in the garrison's suggested tax collectors, all of whom are Chinese and will extort the Uyghur mercilessly.

name: Even Higher Taxes!
description: The city people are unable to provide enough food for the annual tribute to Beijing. Which the garrison insists we still hoard, despite Beijing not asking for any in years. New taxes are being written, that the garrison believes will please Jin Shuren.

name: Seize Nobles Money
description: The Begs of the Khanate are being sought out by the garrison for additional taxation, under the auspice of national security. The families of the Begs are now in hiding with their gold, as both are targets of the garrison's grabbing hand.

name: Punish the Opposition
description: The garrison has finally realised that the Magistrates are trying to resist them. Among the tax collectors and bureaucrats, those that refuse to renounce the symbols of Nasīr, that of the Quran and their courtesy name, have been removed.

name: Road Through Hami
description: The road from Hami to Dihua is treacherous, stretching parallel to the Tarim Basin and surrounded by miles of desert on either sides. The garrison has ordered a new corvée to be assembled to fix the road in the heat. Return for the prisoners is unlikely.

name: Consolidating Xinjiang
description: The gamble taken by Yulbars Khan and Hoja-Niyaz has reached its summit. The cities of Xinjiang are now ours, and our next task is to seek out the deserving to become our allies in a new administration.

name: Rebuilding Xinjiang
description: The calamity that overtook Kumul and Xinjiang is finally over, and we can begin to rebuild. Searchers will be sent out to the cities to find downtrodden men who can be uplifted by our patronage.

name: Southern Textiles
description: The carpet makers of Hotan are starved for clients. Ma Hushan has proposed that we employ the weavers of Hotan to monopolise their famous carpets.

name: Expand the Kumul Road
description: The road along the Tarim Basin was the sight of many battles on the road to victory. The effort the corvée went through to fix the road will need to be repeated.

name: Nascent Industry
description: Stamped gun moulds and crude forges are just the beginning of a functioning military industry in Kumul. It will require new engineers and power generators, but the rewards will be worth it.

name: Military Expansion
description: The defensive divisions that were bolstered during our war must be replaced. By taking our time, we will be able to plan a larger and safer military for future conflicts.

name: Civilian Investments
description: The devastation brought to Kumul shook every home. It would certainly be beneficial if we spend some time rebuilding forges despoiled.

name: New Manufactures
description: Shipments of modern die casting tools are being shipped into Kumul, to be given to our loyal veterans. Xinjiang as a whole will prosper soon enough.

name: Chinese Integration
description: The use of Chinese must not be banned in Kumul. Instead, a bilingual administration will ensure that our orders will be carried out with more accuracy than our enemies could muster.

name: Restart Immigration
description: The Western Gate's troubles scared off potential immigrants for far too long. A declaration by [KUM.GetLeader] will hopefully encourage resettlement and calm fears of further war.

name: Reach out to China
description: The tribute we gave to Beijing every seven years has allowed us to accumulate some experience with the Northern warlords. We should leverage this memory and reach out to China for military protection.

name: Autonomy In Vogue
description: In order to administer the vastness of Xinjiang, we must defer to the same autonomous principle Governor Yang Zengxin afforded us.

name: Promote Local Businesses
description: The commerce in Xinjiang reflects the decades of tensions and segregation the Governors imposed on us. Now, a more harmonious economy can be promoted if we patronise local businesses in all the major cities of Xinjiang.

name: Pardon Rebellious Uyghurs
description: It is the opinion of the ministry that the Uyghur people can easily be made to accept our rule. A select few pious Uyghurs should be pardoned so long as they turn over their arms.

name: Seek Legitimacy
description: A majority of China considers us no more than a rebellious servant. A selection of gifts could convince their own masters that we are worthy of succeeding Xinjiang.

name: Internal Stability
description: A long list of unanswered claims are awaiting our answer. If we are able to satisfy at least half of these claimants, we can pick apart the tangle of instability in our administration.

name: Responsible Government
description: Trust in our administration comes from promoting responsible people. Although many of us began as rebels and insurgents, it does not prevent us from hiring competent executors of our judgement.

name: Defensive Neutrality
description: The Western Gate is now an attractive target for the insurgents of Manchuria and Southern China. We must call upon the General Staff to devise a general defence strategy to prevent another war as destructive as the last.

name: Crossroads of Empires
description: The Russians, the Turks, and even the Japanese eye us as a new borderland. We can no longer deny the presence of their agents in our land, and we must make formal diplomatic contact with these potential enemies and see if any are in favour of our autonomy.

name: Safety and Prosperity
description: If the Uyghur, Han, and Hui people are not split; safety and prosperity will be ensured. This is our great goal of cooperation between the races in Xinjiang.

name: Continuation of the Khanate
description: Upon [KUM.GetLeader]'s ascension, his promise of reforming the Khanate was not taken seriously. Now, backed by force, the Khan intends to carry out his reforms and prove himself to his people.

name: Constitutionalism Prevails
description: The scraps of idealism imported from the south has triumphed in Kumulilik politics. A provincial constitution, with elements of the Kanun-u Esasi of the Ottomans and single party tutelage as promoted by Sun Yat-sen.

name: Invest in the Begs
description: The loyal begs who did not surrender to Jin Shuren will be handsomely rewarded. Their estates will be increased, and they will be given a second pension for serving the Khanate through its existential struggle.

name: Lessons From the Qing
description: The reforms that Emperor Puyi undertook, all while under Zhili observation, are an inspiration to us. A modern monarch must delegate and cultivate trust through his reliance on meritocratic civil government.

name: Abolish the Advisory
description: Hoja-Niyaz and Yulbars Khan have outlived their usefulness. Having military disattached from us will only inspire future military dictatorships to pose as legitimate governments.

name: Constitutional Council
description: From the Begs comes a more respectable Constitutional Council. A council whose duty will be similar to the Ottoman Chamber of Deputies and who will exalt their Khan as much as the Sultan was exalted.

name: Under the Khan
description: [KUM.GetLeader] has taken the counsel of the Advisors and decided on a more direct rule of his new land with military power.

name: Reform the Advisory
description: The Khan has decided to show his gratitude to his two Advisors by restoring their pre-war role.

name: Ensure Loyalty
description: The Advisors promise that they have sufficient leverage in the cities to ensure the mullahs and radicals have no following to oppose us.

name: Create the Royal Guards
description: The Khan needs to be able to put down future insubordinate advisors or begs. This will be best achieved with a Royal Guard in Kumul, paid by and serving only the Khan.

name: End the Power Struggle
description: The tangle of promises made to the people of Kumul has resulted a lot of distrust and uncertainty in our administration. To end the power struggle for good, we must forgo some promises we made to the people we liberated.

name: Necessary Adjustments
description: Some of the magistrates allocated money to projects we simply should not pursue. Rescinding some of this money will enable us to complete our promises on other fronts.

name: Institute Public Schooling
description: Public schooling is one of the few principles we agree with Sheng Shicai on. We however do not intend to subvert the madrassas, but support them and educate the people in complementary skills.

name: Contain Jadidism
description: The Jadidists' desire for Xinjiang is a danger for Kumul, whether it be their interests in fighting Russia or in exalting the Ottoman Sultanate at our expense. We must curb nationalist sentiment or we will face another revolt.

name: Divine Right
description: In the Xidaotang School of Islam, the rightful governance of a province must be under traditional lineage of power. The lineage of the Khans predates that of the Osman, and therefore our rule is just.

name: A Modern Monarchy
description: We have seen many successful revivals of monarchism in countries that looked like they were heading towards chaos. The Qing and the Ottomans are great examples. We must emulate their successes.

name: The Benevolent Autocracy
description: While some may argue that our administration uses the same force that it fought, those critics are fools. Simple truth is that the only way our province was ever stable was under benevolent dictatorships.

name: A Khanate No More
description: The last Khan has been deposed, and the Uyghur people rejoice. Under a more competent and accountable leader, the province can move forward without being saddled to ancient history.

name: The Renegade
description: Once a rebel always a rebel. Hoja-Niyaz has overcome the weak internal controls of Kumul and intends to entrench himself in his new position.

name: Exploit Jadidism
description: The Jadidists are not all bad, especially those with specific needs. Whether it be to ban religions outside of the book or to officially endorse sharia courts, these petty gestures will create a lot of support for our regime.

name: Keep Them Divided
description: The ethnic segregation Masqud Shah promoted was actually beneficial to the survival of Kumul, and [KUM.GetLeader] will honour his ideals by preserving these laws.

name: Matters of State
description: Years of incompetent and lazy foreign diplomacy may now be overturned. Matters of state and external policy may finally be unified under Hoja-Niyaz.

name: Cast Off Ideology
description: Though the would-be leaders of Central Asia command their people with ideology, at its root it is the same message. To respond, we are willing to ally with any power in the region that guarantees a greater autonomy than Xinjiang gave us.

name: Hoja's Republic
description: When Hoja-Niyaz fought against Masqud Shah, he didn't know what he was fighting for. With age comes wisdom, and now [KUM.GetLeader] has realised that, given absolute power, he should serve as president to a Republic.

name: Flexible Diplomacy
description: The foreign office in Kumul has been told to make no promises and no obligations to our neighbours. Keeping a flexible policy will enable us to control our allegiance, and ultimately our destiny.

name: Let Them Pick Us
description: The foreign office has finally been conditioned towards effective indecision, and Hoja-Niyaz is now able to properly court the factions of China on his terms.

name: The Bureaucrat
description: After escaping death, Fan Yaonan has manoeuvred himself into a second once-in-a-lifetime opportunity as Governor of Xinjiang in Kumul.

name: Open for Business
description: The reason for Xinjiang's failure was Yang Zengxin's isolationism. Fan Yaonan is certainly ready to correct decades of draconian trade policies and bring prosperity back to Xinjiang.

name: Request Administrators
description: Fan Yaonan is tapping into his legitimate powers as Governor to hire new administrators who passed the Civil Service Examination.

name: A Safe Investment
description: The wealth that the corrupt Governors hoarded can now be invested properly into Xinjiang's economy. This will enable more people to reap short term benefits from our taxation than just the Governor.

name: Open the Gates
description: The Western Gate is finally open again. Fan Yaonan is very aware of his responsibility to the people of Xinjiang to preserve the peace between Han, Hui, and Uyghur.

name: A Common Cause
description: The common cause of all of the races of Xinjiang is prosperity. From the miners of Hotan to the hunters of Dzungaria. A common currency. defence, and competing with common foes like Mongolia can unite us all.

name: Political Malleability
description: The foreign office in Kumul has been told to make no promises and no obligations to our neighbours. Keeping a flexible policy will enable us to control our allegiance, and ultimately our destiny.

name: Stability Means Prosperity
description: The stability that Fan Yaonan has created in Xinjiang is almost unmatched across the rest of China. This has made it a much better place for economic development and investments.

name: The Vengeful General
description: Through the might of his forces, Ma Zhongying has triumphed in Hami. It is obvious that the feudal lords and bandits would give way to modern autocratic leadership that Ma Zhongying provides.

name: Punish Dissent
description: Modern autocracies need to recognise and intercept radical movements before they can build up steam. This is why Ma Zhongying has decided to rescind many of the pardons he promised to give to surrendering commanders.

name: Slash and Burn
description: The bandits of Dzungaria rely on the weakness of the people and their food stores. We cannot instil such Chinese values of resistance into them, so we should instead force them out and starve out our enemies.

name: An Army With a State
description: The army of Ma Zhongying is paramount to a modern autocratic state. They should receive top priority in taxation and quartering of officials.

name: All For One
description: The entirety of Hami must get behind Ma Zhongying if we are to survive the next few years.

name: The Kumul Army
description: Bloated from what was meant to be a self defence force, the Kumul Army can be made into the most hearty fighting force in Central Asia.

name: Small but Strong
description: What separates Kumul from the Gansu Braves or the provincial army is our successful self reliance. While other armies falter in low supply, we are able to project that future victory in front of us on the long desert roads.

name: Analyse Stolen Guns
description: With outside support scarce, we must rely on Chinese models, which are copies of European weapons already, to make equipment that can beat the invaders we might face in the future.

name: Increase Conscription
description: Every man would give their only begotten son for Kumul!

name: Ice Warriors
description: Brigades acclimatised to the cold will outperform the weary and shivering foreigners that threaten Kumul.

name: Dihua Arms Factory
description: With Dihua ours, their arms factory can be put towards national defence.

name: Steppe Scouts
description: Special divisions, made up of the steppe people, being created would give our divisions better scouting power, speed and reconnaissance.

name: Mountain Training
description: Assigning special brigades of Karakum peoples from the mountains will create uniquely resilient units for combat in our harsh mountain ranges of Xinjiang.

name: A New Direction
description: The Lithuanian Army is in utter tatters and is in desperate need of reforms. Soldiers are prone to taking 'extended' leaves, and officers are either undisciplined or simply untrained. As the clouds of war circle around Europe once more, Lithuania's army stands undoubtedly unprepared. Only through careful and extensive reforms will we modernise our army for the conflicts to come.

name: Gustaitis' Initiative
description: In an era of modern war, control of the skies will be of paramount importance. One of our most prominent officers, Antanas Gustaitis, plans to develop further and modernise our air force to ensure that Lithuania's pilots are among some of the world's best.

name: Reestablish Aviacijos Mokykla
description: One of the first phases of Gustaitis' reforms will be to re-establish the Aviacijos Mokykla or the 'Aviation School' in Kaunas. Here, recruits will be taught by seasoned air veterans to receive modern training and techniques in aerial warfare - ensuring that we will produce the finest of aces.

name: Invite German Aviation Advisors
description: Due to a lack of veteran Lithuanian pilots, we struggle to find experts to teach our developing air force. The Germans, of course, possess quite possibly one of the most modern air forces in the world. Hiring German advisors and veterans who have fought in conflicts worldwide, and are familiar with modern aircraft, will ensure that our pilots receive the best training possible.

name: Airborne Detachment
description: The concept of paratroopers is a relatively new one. By deploying soldiers from the air, one gains a tactical advantage by enabling their forces to attack entrenched enemies from behind or secure critical objectives with complete surprise. With the help of elite German advisors, we will create our paratrooper units, the 'Oro desanto būrys', to apply this concept to our military doctrine.

name: Radar Research
description: There are reports that the new technology of 'radar' has been developed in Germany - using radio waves to detect planes from afar. Given our proximity to Germany, Lithuania will capitalise on this new technology of 'Funkmessgerät' by building our own radar station. A crew of technicians, hand-picked for their intelligence and expertise in radio, will be employed to work at this site.

name: Fund the Army Aviation Workshops
description: Many of the Lithuanian Air Force planes are seriously outdated, with models dating back to the Weltkrieg. As a result, we will provide new grants and funding to the Karo Aviacijos Tiekimo Skyrius to ensure that our mechanics and designers have access to improved plane designs. With the new funding, our workshops will be able to copy and improve on new plane designs to ensure that Lithuania does not fall behind in aviation.

name: ANBO VIII
description: Designed by Antanas Gustaitis himself, the ANBO VIII is a bomber-reconnaissance monoplane built by Karo Aviacijos Tiekimo Skyrius. The concept of its design is that the aircraft can provide close air support while also being nimble enough to provide reconnaissance. Cost-effective and comparable to contemporary European designs, the ANBO VIII demonstrates that Lithuanians can build efficient and adequate aircraft.

name: Open New ANBO Factories
description: Initial testing and trials have demonstrated the success of the ANBO VIII in the air. As we find ourselves again drawn into the conflagration of global war, we will need to build more and more of the ANBO series. The state will help provide funding for our workshops under Karo Aviacijos Tiekimo Skyrius to encourage the production of more military aircraft.

name: 48-Hour Mobilisation
description: The '48 Hour mobilisation' idea is that the Lithuanian Army will be ready to fight and all our defences prepared if war breaks out. Given our army's current state of disorganisation, this won't be easy to achieve. We will begin war games and training exercises to ensure that the Lithuanian Army will soon achieve mobilisation rapidly.

name: Implement NCOs
description: The officer corps of the Lithuanian Army has long been in a series of neglect. To reform our infantry, we will have to start at the ground up and begin implementing non-commissioned officers; men hand-picked explicitly for their leadership and management. Our new NCOs will ensure that missions and orders can be executed without waiting explicitly from headquarters.

name: Instil a Fighting Spirit
description: Most of the regular infantry lacks the motivation and morale to carry out their duties effectively. We will begin a rigorous programme of drilling and propaganda to inspire the men of Lithuania once again to take up arms to defend their country. Over time, we will expect to see a more disciplined fighting force, soldiers willing to give life or limb for their nation.

name: Complete the Army Reform
description: After an intense period of intense and significant reforms, the Lithuanian Army has been brought back to its former glory. With our army reforms a complete success, the days of a disorganised and chaotic Lithuanian Army are over. Our army now reaches the standards of our neighbours, and we are more ready than ever to combat threats externally and internally.

name: Integrate the Riflemen Union
description: The Lithuanian Riflemen Union (Lietuvos Šaulių Sąjunga, LŠS) is a state-supported paramilitary organisation that serves as a bridge between the army and society. The men of the Union are trained militarily, and some are even excellent marksmen given the sportsmanlike culture of the Union. Our military will need experienced riflemen; we will implement the legislation necessary to incorporate the Union into the Lithuanian Army.

name: The Young Riflemen
description: Our country is small, and we will need to prepare even the youth for war if our nation's independence is at risk. The 'Young Riflemen' is a division of the LŠS focused on the youth (11-18) and gives them a taste of service in the military. To prepare the Fatherland for the worse, we will endorse this organisation and give it the funding to ensure that our youth will be ready in times of crisis.

name: Death or Dishonour
description: Our small nation will find itself threatened as war comes to us - the fate of Lithuania is at stake. Lithuanians, young and old, male and female - will fight for every inch of their nation's soil. We must glorify patriotic death and teach all Lithuanians that to die for their country; is a tremendous honour one can have.

name: Expand the Officer Corps
description: The backbone of every military is the officer corps, and despite our implementation of non-commissioned officers, we will need more men capable of leading the Lithuanian Army. We will provide exceptional training and curriculum for those in the officer corps as we expand the size and strength of the Lithuanian officer corps.

name: Study Infiltration Tactics
description: Experience in the later stages of the Weltkrieg showed that elite and disciplined infantry detachments far from headquarters could infiltrate enemy lines and cause havoc. Our military will study these tactics, perfected by the Reichswehr and Baltische Landeswehr, to properly implement them into the Lithuanian Military Doctrine.

name: Establish the War School
description: Our military has no academy to call its own, and while we can always rely on studying at foreign academies, we cannot rely on them to develop and grow our military and doctrine. With this in mind, we will establish the Vilnius War School to train a new generation of officers and generals while also emphasising the study and development of new doctrine and tactics.

name: Hold the Line
description: General Żeligowski's clique, along with his supporters from southern Lithuania, wish to embrace a more defensive and cautious posture to ensure that Lithuania is left unmolested by any potential enemy. They advise us to focus on playing for time until reinforcements from other Reichspakt nations can help us.

name: Territorial Defence Force
description: The 'Lietuvos Vietinė Rinktinė' is our nation's planned initiative to launch a volunteer militia force in times of crisis. Its goal is to call up reservists and militiamen in the hopes of quickly reinforcing our frontlines and solidifying our nation's defence further.

name: Improved Terrain Usage
description: No one knows this land better than us; for generations, our ancestors have long used it as their natural fortification. As we prepare our nation's defences, we will begin scoping out favourable terrains such as forests and hills for us to create emplacements and ambushes. An enemy that attempts to march into Lithuania will suffer the consequences of not understanding our land.

name: Defensive Stratagems
description: Our nation will prepare to brace for the worse. We will expand our trench and fortification systems and emphasise behind-the-lines partisan actions to harass and strike the enemy from the rear. To ensure that our troops have equipment at all times, we will strengthen the communications systems. No enemy will be able to break through our carefully planned defences.

name: Movement Warfare
description: General Plechavičius and his ilk are mostly veterans of the Russian Civil War, where they learned the value of cavalry. This clique has embraced offensive warfare with the use of fast-moving units to flank the enemy with infantry supporting these elements. They seek to increase motorisation and mobility of our forces.

name: Prepare for Enemy Tanks
description: Our forces currently lack the means and weaponry to deal with the armoured beasts that are tanks. As our troops will constantly be on the move, we will ensure that they are equipped with anti-tank weaponry to penetrate even the thickest armour. This will help solidify our defensive and offensive capabilities as we will not have to worry about enemy armour.

name: Army Motorisation
description: Much of our army's transportation and movement is still horse-drawn. If we focus our military on speed entirely, we should invest in motorisation such as trucks and vehicles. While the horse has always been an influential part of our military, the truck is not constrained to fatigue, and we will be able to achieve greater speeds on the battlefield.

name: Old Generals, New Tactics
description: Our military has decided to embrace the art and beauty of speed in warfare fully. Emphasising striking critical points in enemy lines with mobile, manoeuvrable forces, we will focus on speedy offensives to drive the enemy into confusion. Despite our military staff being relatively old, they will be proponents of this new form of warfare; to quickly dash the enemies into smithereens!

name: Local Rifle Manufacturing
description: Our country lacks a proper armaments industry to prepare ourselves for the conflicts to come. We will petition local manufacturers and gunsmiths and begin converting factories for military use to reduce our reliance on foreign weapons in times of war. This will also serve to strengthen our economy as we take steps to construct a proper military industry.

name: Acquire Tank Licences
description: Our industry is not capable yet of producing heavily armoured vehicles, but this should not stop us from pursuing such means. We will begin surveying tank models from Bohemia, Sweden, and Germany to see which ones will suit our military better. By importing foreign tank models, we will have modern tanks and tanks of superior craftsmanship.

name: Seek Military Contracts
description: Our government must look towards the armaments industry for the procurement of modern weapons and equipment. By securing contracts with foreign and domestic weapons industries, we will escalate our military production and capabilities. We can rest assured that our soldiers will be fully equipped at all times with the most modern of weapons.

name: Build the Linkaiciai Artillery Workshops
description: The government has decided to endorse the plans for the construction of the Linkaičiai Artillery Workshops - an ambitious industrial plant capable of housing thousands of workers that will provide for every Lithuanian soldier the rifles, ammunition, and artillery needed to wage a modern war in defence of the Fatherland. Our goal for this factory plant is to be one of the most modern weapons manufacturers in all of Europe.

name: Military-Industrial Complex
description: To aid the developing Lithuanian military industry and ensure our nation is indeed ready for war, the government will have to take drastic measures to prepare Lithuania. We will shift civilian industries to military production while ensuring that both the military sector and the nation's military profit extensively. Not only will this strengthen our economy, but it will also strengthen our national defence.

name: Develop Klaipeda
description: One of the largest ports and cities in Lithuania, Klaipėda will become the home of Lithuania's maturing naval industry. We will begin a government requisition of dockyards and ships in Klaipėda to ensure that the Lithuanian Navy will have the most modern fleet in all of the Baltic Sea.

name: Coastal Guard Expansion
description: One of the most essential seas for maritime trade and travel, the Baltic Sea will indeed become a battleground as the nations of Europe once again devolve into war. As a pivotal member in the Baltics, the Lithuanian Coast Guard must be expanded in terms of our number of ships and sailors to ensure that travel and trade remain safe. We will encourage further enlistment into the naval forces and ensure that our sailors are well-trained and prepared for all that is to come.

name: Seaplanes
description: An interesting proposal from Gustaitis is the intertwining between the navy and the air force. As our navy lacks any major heavy warships to damage enemy fleets, we can instead fit planes for sea travel to ensure that they can act as naval bombers. Taking inspiration from other nations, seaplanes ensure that Lithuania's seas are guarded against the skies above.

name: Submarine Development
description: Submarines are not new, but our young nation has yet to embrace them fully. Having submarines will give us an unparalleled advantage in the seas as we can strike the enemy from the depths. With submarine pens in Palanga, the Lithuanian naval forces can procure foreign submarines to begin our submarine programme. We will hire advisors from foreign countries to instruct and incorporate submarines into our Navy.

name: Naval Construction Contracts
description: We will need more ships if we are to become a naval power in the Baltics. Our current fleet size is not impressive enough, and to boost our numbers, we will seek out contracts with the naval industries domestically and abroad. This ensures that not only are we getting new and modern ships but also ships of superior quality.

name: Establish the Navy
description: Lithuania has never really quite had a strong maritime tradition, with our only access to the sea being the small port of Palanga. Nonetheless, through our development of other ports, our training and expansion of the coast guard, and our growing naval industry, we have built quite an impressive naval force for ourselves. It is now appropriate that we begin to transition the Lithuanian coast guard into a proper Lithuanian Navy.

name: Taming the Nomadic Economy
description: Mongolia is a sparsely populated nation, with about half of the population living nomadically on the steppes. This is a major challenge for economic planners, and will have to be kept in mind as we bring Mongolia into modernity. As we begin our economic reforms, we shall push for greater record-keeping and oversight over arable land as well as push to modernise our agricultural infrastructure.

name: Uliastai Industrialisation Project
description: Mongolia’s economy has traditionally been very pastoral, but in order to ensure its future prosperity and independence, an effort must be made to foster a domestic industrial base. The hub of our latest efforts at creating a light industry shall be in Uliastai, a city in Western Mongolia. With some incentives and interventions, we will focus on processing animal products and providing manufactured goods for our agricultural domestic market.

name: Commission Military Factory
description: Mongolia does not have a large native arms industry and that has historically put us at a disadvantage in our dealings with our neighbours. Our few domestically produced arms are handcrafted, which include beautiful but hopelessly outdated muskets and bows. Though our budget is tight and industry still in its infancy, our leaders are nonetheless determined. They might not be the newest or finest guns, but with great effort Mongolia will see its first weapon's plant!

name: Fund Nomad Development
description: Aid to nomadic clans is key to help people thrive across the steppes and ensure their continued loyalty. Nomads are particularly at the mercy of winter, with challenges maintaining a viable flock. By providing resources to help protect their animals from disease and inclement weather, we will alleviate the burden they face each year. Combined with the promotion of a new mining and timber industry, we will eliminate rural economic stagnation and bring new prosperity!

name: Develop Urga’s Infrastructure
description: Urga is our largest city and capital, but frankly only qualifies as a city at all on a seasonal basis. As our government’s seat of power and the symbol of the reforms we seek to bring to Mongolia, it is imperative that we invest in permanent infrastructure to and within the city. New roads and bridges will be constructed, connecting outlying villages to Urga, and old ones will be refurbished. This will be the foundation of our burgeoning economy.

name: Khovd Factory
description: Khovd is another western Mongolian city that is in urgent need of industrial development. Taking inspiration from our work in the neighbouring Uliastai, we will begin a programme of domestic industrial investment, focusing on light industrial products capable of servicing the region’s farmers. Our burgeoning industrial economy will allow us to fund further projects to better extract Mongolia’s rich natural resources for foreign export.

name: Weapons Development
description: Our weapons are of an extremely poor standard, mostly surplus weapons given to us by great powers when we were vassals. Many are old enough to be relics in a museum! If we are to keep our independence, it is imperative that we have a centralised and effective method of arms procurement. Licences and contracts will have to be made with foreign designers, no doubt at a price, but our Ministry of Defence will have weapons on par with our foes.

name: The Trans-Mongolian Railway
description: The Trans-Mongolian Railway has gone through numerous planning stages and development pitfalls, but the dream has remained the same: the creation of a massive railway across the steppes. With our relative independence from both Beijing and Moscow and new-found domestic stability, it is time we finally bring these plans out of the drawing board and into reality. Our government will finally back a venture to start laying down tracks to better connect Mongolia together!

name: Urga Officer School
description: In Mongolia, military training has been mostly ad hoc, with most officers taught on the job or in their own homes. To rectify this, in 1921 Baron von Ungern-Sternberg built a small academy in Urga. The elegant, Russian-styled facility is one of the few permanently standing buildings in the city, but it was shuttered by recent fighting. We will begin with recruiting instructors and opening cadet applications soon.

name: The Mongolian Military
description: The Mongolian military is dominated by mounted troops, who are able to navigate the vast flat steppes. These mounted forces have protected us for many years, but as the world begins to change so must we. A modern military is needed, and so a new military commission has been established to oversee the implementation of military reforms across Mongolia. May they continue to defend our home and our people!

name: Further Military Development
description: With our weapons procurement project well underway, our troops are better supplied and equipped, but the same can be said of our enemies. Mongolia's continued security is a moving target and to meet future challenges we must go further with fostering our domestic defence industry. Funds will be directed towards new munitions plants and hiring foreign experts. We may not trust all of our neighbours, but we will be able to trust our heroic soldiers!

name: New Production Techniques
description: New weapons designs must be acquired to supply our troops with modern arms. Moreover, while we have made great strides in our production techniques, there are many areas where we are lacking both in quality and quantity. Using the foreign blueprints and technicians we can get our hands on, and having our domestic designers fill in the gaps, we will seek to continue to keep Mongolia’s military competitive.

name: Review our Methods
description: The instability of China has allowed us to gain de facto independence, and years of fighting both foreign invaders and ourselves has given us an experienced, if outdated, military. With our nation now fully united, it is time to begin consolidating the lessons our men have learned and building a modern Mongolian military. The methods of our military should be looked into, to see whether we could reform our military to become more effective.

name: Work With Our Territory
description: We must understand that the territory of our nation is very difficult to transverse and fight in, ranging from flat steppes to steep hills and treacherous mountains. Either we can be cowed by it or we can work with our natural environment. Outposts will be created, supply bases created, safe routes charted out, and amiable connections with helpful locals will give us a leg up in moving and defending our home. While our enemies struggle with the terrain, we will be right at home.

name: Recruitment Effort
description: With such a low population, Mongolia needs every soldier it can reasonably get. Now that our domestic troubles have been resolved, at least for now, we need to begin a new recruitment plan to increase our numbers. We will begin by streamlining recruitment and more carefully documenting our rosters to eliminate ‘ghost soldiers’ and desertions. An army capable of modern warfare must move away from seasonal levies and militias and aim towards more reliable professionals.

name: Nomadic Recruitment Policy
description: The nomadic peoples living in Mongolia are adept at horseback riding but can be difficult to keep track of for conscription. Careful negotiations with tribal leaders and greater sign-on bonuses will allow us to better access nomadic populations for potential recruits. Their experience is invaluable and will be a great boon for our reorganised defence forces.

name: Tribal Recruitment Policy
description: Some clans are rather isolated and remain untapped potential for military enlistment. By building inroads, material concessions and the possibility of a new life away from impoverished rural regions, we can further swell our ranks with hardy soldiers. In addition, now that our government’s stability is no longer in doubt we can begin to recruit the veterans of the defeated factions of our civil war and incorporate them into our army.

name: Train our Officers
description: Many officers in Mongolia are poorly trained, and forced to learn by experience. With the establishment of the National Defence University, it is now time to begin creating a new curriculum for our cadets. Our faculty primarily consist of veterans from Mongolia’s various border wars and foreign military advisors. Together they have been instructed to create a modern doctrine tailored towards the needs of the steppes.

name: Develop Radio Technology
description: Mongolia is a large, sparsely populated nation and its people are divided by long distances and high mountains. Radio and electronic technology has great potential to help solve this divide. Furthermore, Radios have been used since the Weltkrieg for effective communications between generals and their soldiers. If we are to defend our homes, incorporating radios into our doctrines is a must!

name: Ungern's Mongolia
description: Mongolia, for now, remains in the hands of the Baron Ungern-Sternberg. Though this position is threatend by fast-moving political currents. Ungern must act now if he is to remain in his position.

name: Bribe the Princes
description: Though the nobles are currently opposing our government, we can easily take some of the less loyal nobles by bribing them. The princes should be so pliant towards conformity after decades of Chinese suppression.

name: Purge the Princes
description: The Princes have always been a problem, holding far too much influence in Mongolian government. It is time they see their end.

name: Ignore the Princes
description: The princes are not truly the issue we are facing. We must focus on other avenues, and perhaps even get support from them in defeating other factions.

name: Nobility Assist in Destroying Buddhists
description: Using the Princes' vast wealth, they have agreed to help us crush some of the Buddhist resistance in Urga.

name: Nobility Assist in Destroying Democrats
description: Using the Princes vast wealth, they have agreed to help us crush some of the socialist resistance in Urga.

name: Impose Authoritarian Ideas
description: Many in Urga currently believe that perhaps it is time for democracy. The problem is that they do not realise how wrong they are, and must be disciplined to stop democracy from infesting the whole of the nation.

name: Display Ungern's Buddhism
description: Many in Mongolia do not believe Ungern-Sternberg is committed enough to protecting Buddhism and acting in a Buddhist lifestyle. Some public displays of him and some loyal monks meditating and holding some speeches should convince them otherwise.

name: The New Buddhist Icon
description: Though Ungern-Sternberg is not a tulku like the Bogd Khan, he should still be known as a Buddhist figure of almost equal importance in Mongolia. Fortunately foundational work like the Tibetan Agvan Dorzhiev's work 'The Shambhala Prayer' is already well known and easy material to manipulate for propaganda.

name: Cult of Personality
description: To make sure Ungern-Sternberg remains in power, the propaganda around his cult of personality should be temporarily increased massively. This cult of personality relies on mythmaking that officer Ossendowski is adept at spinning.

name: Enforce Officer Loyalty
description: The officer class is a hotbed for noble traitors, socialist rebels and Buddhist extremists. Their loyalty should be tested and hardened to root out these issues. To the general staff, this measure also helps restrict the ability of Russian politics to influence their decisionmaking.

name: Urga Military Parade
description: Nothing gets the peoples support and shows dominance more than a military parade. To the people of Urga, a military parade is more of a holiday than a display of power, owing to the newness of the concept. Regardless of whether the crowd is satiated by fun or fear, it will help secure our rule in the city.

name: Arrest Any Opponent
description: Though before we had strict laws about opposition, it is obvious these laws aren't strict enough. The prisons should be overflowing with opponents before the nation is safe.

name: Ungern Secures Power
description: Finally, Ungern-Sternberg and his Russian military clique have defeated the opposition, and have once again taken the reins of the nation. Renewed by the vigour of military victory, the Russian-led junta is ready to make their postulations into reality.

name: A Democratic Mongolia
description: Now is the time for change. We must seize the chance, and inspired from other democracies of the east, bring Mongolia to the democratic world.

name: Circulate Pro-democratic Leaflets
description: In such a traditional society that Mongolia is, many people do not know the modern ways of socialism and democracy. Leaflets should be distributed to teach them the way.

name: Ungern, the Traitor
description: Some in Mongolia truly believe that the butcher Ungern-Sternberg is good for Mongolia! An anti-Ungern propaganda campaign should be started, informing people of how brutal the Baron's rule has been.

name: Peasant March in the Capital
description: It is time for the peasants' voices to be heard! A march through the capital should show that the people must be heard, and we will wait no longer!

name: Seize the Nobles' Wealth
description: The noble princes get their power and influence through their money, money they earned exploiting the people of this nation. Their wealth should be seized indiscriminately to help the people.

name: Cooperate with Monasteries
description: The monasteries, the more neutral ones at least, are not our enemies, and we should try to work with them to destroy radical Buddhist influence and help promote socialism and democracy.

name: Remove Corrupt Aristocrats
description: The aristocratic princes are what is keeping the people down! Their corruption cannot go unpunished, and they must be removed from their posts.

name: Remove Russians from Government
description: Many Russian nationals still work in our government, holding secret sympathies to the Baron. They must be removed to keep our regime safe.

name: Declare a Constitutional Monarchy
description: Finally, we have succeeded! Democracy and socialism has won in Urga. Now, we must work on transforming the nation into a democratic and equal society.

name: The Nobility Takes Power
description: The noble princes of Mongolia, who have ruled Mongolia for years throughout history, have taken power once again, and must act fast to secure their rule.

name: Pander to Buddhists
description: Religion is not a major point for the princes, but for the population it is very important. Appealing to Buddhists will help weaken the power of the Buddyn Zövlöl.

name: Destroy the Buddyn Zövlöl
description: All of our resources must be used to crush the power of the Buddyn Zövlöl, to stop their radical Buddhists from coming to power and threatening our rule.

name: Silence the Impoverished
description: The impoverished peasants of Mongolia are not important enough to have a voice. They are trying to force their way into power to steal our money and bring the country into chaos. They must be silenced.

name: Empower Landowners
description: Rich landowners are some of our main supporters in Mongolia, and control much of the land that many peasants work on. They should be empowered in law to help stop the peasant uprising.

name: Pay off Disloyal Officers
description: Many of the officers of our army lack loyalty to our government. Using our vast wealth, we should bribe some of them to increase their loyalty.

name: National Citizen Guard
description: Many of the peasants do support our regime, as they know they are unable to make the right decision themselves and trust us to handle it. We should form the National Citizen Guard, a group of peasant militia to fight against rebel peasants.

name: Princes' Personal Guard
description: Many of the princes have a personal guard to protect themselves. These guards should be organised more to fight off rebels.

name: The Aristocratic Kingdom
description: Finally, our aristocratic class has taken full power once again, after having to share it with the Baron Ungern-Sternberg. We can now turn Mongolia back to nationalism and traditionalism.

name: Buddhist Revolution
description: Mongolia is at its core a Buddhist nation. Now, the Buddhist council has taken power, to steer the nation back to pure Buddhist nationalism.

name: Declare the Nobles Traitors
description: The people listen to the lamas of Mongolia, and see them as trustworthy authority figures. The people must be informed that the noble princes are traitors to Mongolia.

name: Arrest the Noble Council
description: The Noble Council, led by Demchugdongrub, are an evil group of traitors. They must be arrested and stopped.

name: Slander Ungern's Buddhism
description: The Mad Baron Ungern-Sternberg pretends to be a Buddhist icon. However, he is not even fully Buddhist at all, and does not have Mongolian roots. The people must be taught that they are being lied to.

name: End Russian Influence
description: Russian influence is pervasive in Mongolian society. This link must be cut, so that we can act alone.

name: Distribute Aid through Monasteries
description: The people who are struggling after the previous government abandoned them need help. We should give out aid through the monasteries to gain their support.

name: Empower the Monasteries
description: The monasteries are the cornerstone of Mongolian society. They should be protected and empowered.

name: Persecute non-Buddhists
description: Non-Buddhists are generally rebellious types, fighting against our government. They do not belong in Mongolian society and the main ones should be persecuted.

name: The Theocratic State
description: Finally, Buddhism has won in Mongolia. We can now push to transform Mongolia to a religious theocracy much like that of Tibet or Bhutan.

name: The Provisional Government
description: With the core of China under our control, we have set up a new Provisional Government that will work on a new, hopefully permanent, constitution and create a united Republic that will stand the test of time.

name: Strengthen Parliament
description: Democrats all over China agree that Parliament must be strengthened to secure democracy in the country and ensure that authoritarians are unable to usurp power in the young Republic once again.

name: Empower the Presidency
description: The failure of the previous republican government shows that the government's powers must be clearly defined and the importance of the presidency to ensure stability and proper governance.

name: Federalist Model
description: The Federalist movement in China has risen and fallen several times since the Xinhai Revolution, but they remain an important movement in our provisional government. A federal system will ensure that powers are properly separated and that local affairs remain in the hands of the locals who understand their own problems better than any central government.

name: Attack Provincialism
description: Provincialism is a tool to divide our nation into fiefdoms and federalism is an attempt to institutionalise this. The supremacy of the central government must be ensured, for it is the only way China will be properly reunited as a single nation and not a collection of local tyrants.

name: Legacy of Xinhai
description: The Xinhai Revolution marks the birth of modern China and the Republic. It and its revolutionaries must be honoured and commemorated, as their legacy will live on as long as our Republic lives.

name: National Protection Legacy
description: The National Protection movements have become a symbol of our leaders' and armies' commitment to republicanism and constitutionalism, and they should be honoured along with the Xinhai Revolution that birthed our Republic, as they made sure that the Republic survived.

name: The New Republic
description: With the lessons from the old Republic, we can build a new Republic. A new order in China, one that truly respects the legacy of its founders, republicanism, constitutionalism, and democracy, will be born and, this time, endure.

name: Personality Cult
description: [Root.GetLeader] is the sole reason that the National Protection Alliance was able to crush the monarchists, radicals, and pretenders and restore the legacy of the Xinhai Revolution. Without him, there would be no Republic, and his legacy as liberator of China will endure.

name: The New Bureaucracy
description: From ruling a province or two to ruling the core of China, our bureaucracy has been struggling to say the least. Whether we adopted a federalist or centralist model, new civil servants need to be hired and the entire service must be reorganised from scratch.

name: New National Assembly Election
description: The new government cannot hope to act legitimately as a Republic without assembling a new Parliament. New election to the National Assembly are to be held for the first time in decades (discounting illegitimate ones by the Manchu tyrants of course), helping bring legitimacy to our Provisional Government.

name: National Reunification
description: With a new National Assembly gathered and a new Constitution ratified, our government is no longer provisional, but the sole legitimate government of China. President [Root.GetLeader] will lead the nation towards National Reunification, and China will be once again united and free. Long live the Republic!

name: Reintegrate Academies
description: Military academies are scattered throughout China since before the Xinhai Revolution and have largely developed independently since the first collapse of the Qing Dynasty. They must be reintegrated and the curriculum of all officers standardised once more.

name: Standardised Arsenals
description: For several decades, the arsenals of China have been under the control of different and largely independent provincial and national governments. Now that a number of those arsenals are under our control, the logistical issues stemming from different arsenals producing different arms in different calibre for a single army are substantial and should be rectified as soon as possible.

name: Small Arms Development
